name: Dancer - On the Run 7"
description:
Sick new back-to-basics rock'n'roll outta San Francisco for fans of Hollies, Heartbreakers, Twilley and all your favorite drug-damaged pop bands. Featuring DeeDee "Danzler" Robbins, Jeremiah from Box Elders and Colin from Outdoorsmen. 300 pressed, black vinyl.

A-side: On the Run You Got It Man
B-side: Shirley In Love

name: John Wesley Coleman III - Little Miss Keith Richards LP
description:
John Wesley Coleman's third full-length LP, following up Steal My Mind on Certified PR and Bad Lady Goes to Jail on Goner Records. From Austin, TX, Wes has been making a name for himself for years as a member of the Golden Boys and as a writer and an artist. Little Miss Keith Richards is a pure, primitive Texan party record with some psych, some pop and a big dose of real rock'n'roll. 500 pressed on black vinyl with free digital download.

A-Side:
Razzle Dazzle On a Bus Sleeping in a Dog's Bed Little Miss Keith Richards Jump into the Fire

B-Side: Gypsy From Kentucky Ding Dong Songwriter Werewolf Soup I Guess We're Going to Bed Outerspace Tequila

name: Dan Melchior Und Das Menace - Christmas for the Crows LP
description:
A milestone record for Dan Melchior that delves deeper into his psych inclinations and twists them up with barbed-wire folk lyrics and jagged guitar. 1000 pressed on 180 gram vinyl.

A-Side:
She's Incorrigible SWAMP! (I'm the) Lonesome Ghost Good old down home Muzak Ad Man Rag Norman Roake Street of Crocodiles

B-Side: In a Daze Twig Like Fingers Dirt Hamming it up on the dirt farm GTF #2 Hoochie Bluesy Heap Wurd Hoard Jerusalem

name: Blank Dogs - Stuck Inside the World 7" SOLD OUT
description:
Wigged out home recordings from the prolific electro-psych wunderkind.

A-Side: In A Web / They Said
B-Side: Stuck Inside The World

name: The Pizzas - Bad Ass Youth 7"  SOLD OUT
description:
Three lo-fi insta-punk-classics coming out of Sacramento, CA. Their first release. Fans of ye ol' Rip Off Records will surely dig.

A-Side: Bad-Ass Youth
B-Side: Hideous Fashion/Too Popular

name: Imaginary Icons - Imaginary Icons 7"  SOLD OUT
description: Both songs on their debut sport a Wire-like economy and a similar sense of verse-chorus-verse change. And like Paris Frustration tempers their Joy Division obsession with some Crisis, these boys seem to cut the Wire with the Subway Sect. This is a great record and it gets better with each listen. -Scott Soriano, Zap Gun A-Side: Eye-Cons B-Side: Fade

name: LiveFastDie / VCR - Split 7"  SOLD OUT
description: LiveFastDie - LIVEFASTDIE shake things up with some dirty Neanderthal rock 'n' roll on "Bang It's War," then follow it up with the lo-fi pop sensibility of "Lovedogs in Space." Unbelievably dumb and unbelievably catchy with a nice, simple guitar hook and an exceedingly repetitive chorus that brings to mind ROKY ERICKSON's "I Walked With a Zombie." -Vince Horner, Maximum Rock'n'Roll VCR - Had the Velvet Underground festered in underground obscurity in, say, Dayton, Ohio, instead of being liked in New York, and only rabid obscurists held their only 7" aloft like a chalice, my two cents is that they'd sound like VCR. The late '70s have folded into the mid '00s like a Mad Magazine back cover: the elements are the same, but when creased over the past three decades, it somehow sounds a little new and good-funny again. - Todd Taylor, Razorcake Magazine A-Side - LiveFastDie: Bang It's War / LoveDogs In Space B-Side - V.C.R.: Xmas Calculator / Goodbye Fun

name: Imaginary Icons - Imaginary Icons 12" EP
description:
New York’s Imaginary Icons churn out an awesome blend of 70s brit-punk, wavey synth-skronk and d.i.y. pop and create their own unique sound. 7 songs, 500 hand-stamped and hand-numbered copies on a 12” 45 rpm slab of 180g vinyl.

"One song into this seven-track gem and I'm hooked. Post-punk herky-jerky bleakness tackled by a bunch of punks, which lends it the energy usually devoid in this scene. One-part BUZZCOCKS, two-parts MISSION OF BURMA, three-parts FRUSTRATION, and while I'm at it, a big dirty spoonful of WIRE. The 12" format is perfect" - Sean Dougan, Maximum Rock'n'Roll "Massive improvements have shaken this NYC post-punk outfit out of imitator status and into one hell of a record here, delivering on all sorts of big, confident moves on a familiar canvas, yet one that the band members clearly respect. Think the sort of action that ATV or Wire would have pulled back in '78, with the sort of heft that a first-wave revival like the Volcano Suns swung around with such determination. Four of these seven songs are better than just about anyone who's gone down this path, and would stack up to anything off the last two A Frames albums. You'll just have to pick up the record to figure out which ones. 500 hand-numbered copies, 180g vinyl." - Doug Mosurock, Dusted Magazine
A-Side: Mirror Panics CCTV Economics Is Everything Cellular Automata
B-Side: New Face of France Trace Yourself Rosa Luxemburg

name: DC Snipers/Tampoffs - Split 7"  SOLD OUT
description: DC Snipers - "(Baby) Don't You Be So Violent" could very well be their best, a real Seventies-sounding guitar rock killer. Very contagious and a little bit sleazy. "Dirtbag" continues in the same vein, this song would definitely have a moustache and continually be asking you if you have any rolling papers if it came to life. - Rich Kroneiss, Terminal Boredom Tampoffs - They come out smoking with a pair of tuneful garage-punk blasters recalling the glory days of Rip Off Records. I know, I know: ya been there, done that. But it don't matter. This band rules. This is fast, catchy stuff laden with energy and excitement. Totally fun, ultra-rockin'. - Lord Rutledge, Now Wave A-Side - DC Snipers: (Baby) Don't Be So Violent / Dirtbag B-Side - Tampoffs: Gentlemen / Lead

name: Dan Melchior Und Das Menace - Elev to Mezz 7"  SOLD OUT
description: (T)he new Dan Melchior Und Das Menace single is out, and it's the shotgun blast to the belly we expected: a two man effort that combines keys with Melchior's murk to great effect. Hear what happens when someone calls Dan a hippy. It's groovy! - Byron Coley, The Wire A-Side: Elev To Mezz B-Side: Gravy Train & Ice Cream Truck / Hippy!

name: Hubble Bubble - Hubble Bubble LP SOLD OUT
description:
The first legit vinyl re-issue of an album widely considered one of the best European punk records of all time. Hubble Bubble was based out of Brussels, Belgium and released this album full of manic vicious pop masterpieces in 1978. The band were ALAIN "ALAN VON BUR" BUREAU, ROGER "JUNIOR" JOURET, and DANIEL "DEE" MASSART. Jouret later had huge success as PLASTIC BERTRAND with his hit song "Ca Plane Pour Moi".

A-Side: Big Star Rolling Look Around (I Was So Upset) New Promotion I Wanna Die (But Not Right Now) San Fransisco Little Jeanie Freaks ... Out!

B-Side: Sweet Rot New Direction Born a Woman You'll Be The One My Cadillac I'm Not Like Everybody Else Pogo Pogo

name: Hubble Bubble - Faking LP
description:
Vinyl reissue of the great second Hubble Bubble album! It's a killer mix of punk and glam, keeping the snot and pop of the first album and throwing in some Bowie swagger.

A-Side: Bad Trashing Long Cigarette It's Over Baby Come With Us I Don't Mind Number Sixty-Four Motor Boat
B-Side: Faking What Can I Do Diana Diana Down The Downgrade Hello I Love You Number Sixty-Four (Part 2) Santa Maria Faking (Finale)

name: Photobooth - Da Mes Tus Besos 7"
description:
First 7" from one of the best current Bay Area bands. Awesome garage-pop tunes that'll bounce around in your brain for days. Features former members of FM Knives and Mothballs.
Limited color vinyl (100 copies) available only direct from Daggerman Records. COLOR VINYL IS SOLD OUT
A-Side: Da Me Tus Besos B-Side: 3 In The Morning / You

name: Spider Bags - Hey Delinquents 7"
description:
Their first 7" and a follow-up to their LP on Birdman Records. Spider Bags began as a side-project for Dan McGee, the guitarist of the DC Snipers. Now they're a North Carolina based drunken shamble of a roots band with feet in the trashy garage and punk worlds. The flip side of this was produced by Camero Werewolf, the scum wiz behind Live Fast Die.
Limited color vinyl (100 copies) only available direct from Daggerman Records. COLOR VINYL IS SOLD OUT
A-Side: Hey Delinquents B-Side: Professionals

name: Ebonics - Rock'n'Roll 7" SOLD OUT
description:
Awesome trashy punk single from San Francisco's newest group of miscreants. Folks looking for a good dose of the old fashioned punk-rock will be stoked on this release.
Ebonics has members of Les Hormones, Traditional Fools and Cointel Brothers.
Limited to 300 copies.
EBONICS 7" (DMR-013) A: Rock'n'Roll/Partytime B: Down on 16th / Hitler's Wife

name: DC Snipers - DC Snipers LP SOLD OUT
description:
The long over-due follow-up to the DC Snipers' 2006 Missile Sunset LP, this eponymous second album kills with KBD sleazed out punk action. 400 pressed on 180g black vinyl. Hand screened jacket with lyric insert.

A-Side: Reaction I Drink Seawater Evil Zagreb City Boys Ice Pirates TBM

B-Side: Eye of the Storm/Cutting You Up I Want Some Knives Meter Meet Her Desolate Hills Suicide Policemen

name: Golden Boys - Thee Electric Wolfman LP
description:
The fourth album from Austin, TX beer-drenched rockers, Golden Boys, is a shambolic collection of party rockers and soulful wailers.
Produced by Greg Ashley (of Gris Gris) with guest musicians including Ashley, Memphis legend Ross Johnson, and the Spider Bags. Co-released with Alien Snatch Records. The LP is pressed on 180g vinyl and includes free MP3 downloads.

"The Golden Boys are real Texas punk rock. There's no pretention, no etiquette, and there, on the faces of all six nonboys, are huge, stretched-out smiles. Remember when rock & roll used to be fun?" - Austin Chronicle
A-Side: Electric Wolfman Rock With Me Forever Plainsman's Lament She Said It Kontroll Girls I'm Black And White

B-Side: Old Man's Coat Goddamn I Love The Ocean Dish Towel Mr. Dickles A Message From Ross Johnson

name: Wild Thing - Age Difference 7" SOLD OUT
description:
San Francisco punks return with their second 7" after last year's debut on Clown College Records. Yellin' Brace Belden (ex-Warkrime) and the gang spit out three new tunes about wantin' to die, underage lovin', and smokin' cigs. PUNK IS BACK.
Limited color vinyl (100 copies) available only direct from Daggerman Records. COLOR VINYL IS SOLD OUT
A-Side: (Now I Wanna Die In A) Nuclear War Age Difference B-Side: I'm Smoking (Leave Me Alone)

name: Outdoorsmen - You and Me and Rock'n'Roll 7"
description:
A four song seven-inch from San Francisco's reigning kings of 'don't give a fuck' garage-punk. This outing leans on the poppier side of their songbook and has some recent crowd favorites.

A-Side: You and Me and Rock'n'Roll Slap My Hand
B-Side: Suntan Lotion Singer In The Band
